-- | When included in a receipt rule, this action adds a header to the
--   received email.
--   
--   For information about adding a header using a receipt rule, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--

--   dashes only.

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.BounceAction

-- | When included in a receipt rule, this action rejects the received
--   email by returning a bounce response to the sender and, optionally,
--   publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon
--   SNS).
--   
--   For information about sending a bounce message in response to a
--   received email, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBounceAction</a> smart constructor.
data BounceAction
BounceAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> BounceAction

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when
--   the bounce action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:BounceAction'] :: BounceAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMTP enhanced status code, as defined by <a>RFC 3463</a>.
[$sel:statusCode:BounceAction'] :: BounceAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMTP reply code, as defined by <a>RFC 5321</a>.
[$sel:smtpReplyCode:BounceAction'] :: BounceAction -> Text

-- | Human-readable text to include in the bounce message.
[$sel:message:BounceAction'] :: BounceAction -> Text

-- | The email address of the sender of the bounced email. This is the
--   address from which the bounce message will be sent.
[$sel:sender:BounceAction'] :: BounceAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BounceAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the

data BulkEmailDestinationStatus
BulkEmailDestinationStatus' :: Maybe BulkEmailStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BulkEmailDestinationStatus

-- | The status of a message sent using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Possible values for this parameter include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Success</tt>: Amazon SES accepted the message, and will
--   attempt to deliver it to the recipients.</li>
--   <li><tt>MessageRejected</tt>: The message was rejected because it
--   contained a virus.</li>
--   <li><tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt>: The sender's email address or
--   domain was not verified.</li>
--   <li><tt>ConfigurationSetDoesNotExist</tt>: The configuration set you
--   specified does not exist.</li>
--   <li><tt>TemplateDoesNotExist</tt>: The template you specified does not
--   exist.</li>
--   <li><tt>AccountSuspended</tt>: Your account has been shut down because
--   of issues related to your email sending practices.</li>
--   <li><tt>AccountThrottled</tt>: The number of emails you can send has
--   been reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending
--   limit.</li>
--   <li><tt>AccountDailyQuotaExceeded</tt>: You have reached or exceeded
--   the maximum number of emails you can send from your account in a
--   24-hour period.</li>
--   <li><tt>InvalidSendingPoolName</tt>: The configuration set you
--   specified refers to an IP pool that does not exist.</li>
--   <li><tt>AccountSendingPaused</tt>: Email sending for the Amazon SES
--   account was disabled using the UpdateAccountSendingEnabled
--   operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>ConfigurationSetSendingPaused</tt>: Email sending for this
--   configuration set was disabled using the
--   UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>InvalidParameterValue</tt>: One or more of the parameters you
--   specified when calling this operation was invalid. See the error
--   message for additional information.</li>
--   <li><tt>TransientFailure</tt>: Amazon SES was unable to process your
--   request because of a temporary issue.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt>: Amazon SES was unable to process your request.
--   See the error message for additional information.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:BulkEmailDestinationStatus'] :: BulkEmailDestinationStatus -> Maybe BulkEmailStatus

--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.

-- | A description of an error that prevented a message being sent using
--   the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet

-- | The name of the configuration set.
--   
--   Configuration sets let you create groups of rules that you can apply
--   to the emails you send using Amazon SES. For more information about
--   using configuration sets, see <a>Using Amazon SES Configuration
--   Sets</a> in the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data ConfigurationSet
ConfigurationSet' :: Text -> ConfigurationSet

-- | The name of the configuration set. The name must meet the following
--   requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_),
--   or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain 64 characters or fewer.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:ConfigurationSet'] :: ConfigurationSet -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ConfigurationSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ConfigurationSet'</a>, <a>configurationSet_name</a> - The
--   name of the configuration set. The name must meet the following
--   requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_),
--   or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain 64 characters or fewer.</li>
--   </ul>
newConfigurationSet :: Text -> ConfigurationSet

-- | The name of the configuration set. The name must meet the following
--   requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_),
--   or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain 64 characters or fewer.</li>
--   </ul>
configurationSet_name :: Lens' ConfigurationSet Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet.ConfigurationSet
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet.ConfigurationSet
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet.ConfigurationSet
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet.ConfigurationSet

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet.ConfigurationSet
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.ConfigurationSet.ConfigurationSet

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content

-- | Represents textual data, plus an optional character set specification.
--   
--   By default, the text must be 7-bit ASCII, due to the constraints of
--   the SMTP protocol. If the text must contain any other characters, then
--   you must also specify a character set. Examples include UTF-8,
--   ISO-8859-1, and Shift_JIS.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContent</a> smart constructor.
data Content
Content' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Content

-- | The character set of the content.
[$sel:charset:Content'] :: Content -> Maybe Text

-- | The textual data of the content.
[$sel:data':Content'] :: Content -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Content</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:charset:Content'</a>, <a>content_charset</a> - The character
--   set of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Content'</a>, <a>content_data</a> - The textual data of
--   the content.
newContent :: Text -> Content

-- | The character set of the content.
content_charset :: Lens' Content (Maybe Text)

-- | The textual data of the content.
content_data :: Lens' Content Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.Content.Content


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body

-- | Represents the body of the message. You can specify text, HTML, or
--   both. If you use both, then the message should display correctly in
--   the widest variety of email clients.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBody</a> smart constructor.
data Body
Body' :: Maybe Content -> Maybe Content -> Body

-- | The content of the message, in HTML format. Use this for email clients
--   that can process HTML. You can include clickable links, formatted
--   text, and much more in an HTML message.
[$sel:html:Body'] :: Body -> Maybe Content

-- | The content of the message, in text format. Use this for text-based
--   email clients, or clients on high-latency networks (such as mobile
--   devices).
[$sel:text:Body'] :: Body -> Maybe Content

-- | Create a value of <a>Body</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:html:Body'</a>, <a>body_html</a> - The content of the message,
--   in HTML format. Use this for email clients that can process HTML. You
--   can include clickable links, formatted text, and much more in an HTML
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:Body'</a>, <a>body_text</a> - The content of the message,
--   in text format. Use this for text-based email clients, or clients on
--   high-latency networks (such as mobile devices).
newBody :: Body

-- | The content of the message, in HTML format. Use this for email clients
--   that can process HTML. You can include clickable links, formatted
--   text, and much more in an HTML message.
body_html :: Lens' Body (Maybe Content)

-- | The content of the message, in text format. Use this for text-based
--   email clients, or clients on high-latency networks (such as mobile
--   devices).
body_text :: Lens' Body (Maybe Content)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.Body.Body

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | Contains information about a custom verification email template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomVerificationEmailTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
CustomVerificationEmailTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | The name of the custom verification email template.
[$sel:templateName:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.
[$sel:templateSubject:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
[$sel:successRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
[$sel:failureRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomVerificationEmailTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplate_templateName</a> - The name of the
--   custom verification email template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateSubject:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplate_templateSubject</a> - The subject
--   line of the custom verification email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplate_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email
--   address that the custom verification email is sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:successRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplate_successRedirectionURL</a> - The URL
--   that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his or her
--   address is successfully verified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplate_failureRedirectionURL</a> - The URL
--   that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his or her
--   address is not successfully verified.
newCustomVerificationEmailTemplate :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | The name of the custom verification email template.
customVerificationEmailTemplate_templateName :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.
customVerificationEmailTemplate_templateSubject :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
customVerificationEmailTemplate_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
customVerificationEmailTemplate_successRedirectionURL :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
customVerificationEmailTemplate_failureRedirectionURL :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplate (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate.CustomVerificationEmailTemplate


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination

-- | Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and
--   BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the <i>local part</i> of a
--   destination email address (the part of the email address that precedes
--   the @ sign) may only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the
--   <i>domain part</i> of an address (the part after the @ sign) contains
--   non-ASCII characters, they must be encoded using Punycode, as
--   described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Destination

-- | The recipients to place on the To: line of the message.
[$sel:toAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The recipients to place on the CC: line of the message.
[$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The recipients to place on the BCC: line of the message.
[$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:toAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_toAddresses</a> -
--   The recipients to place on the To: line of the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_ccAddresses</a> -
--   The recipients to place on the CC: line of the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bccAddresses</a>
--   - The recipients to place on the BCC: line of the message.
newDestination :: Destination

-- | The recipients to place on the To: line of the message.
destination_toAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | The recipients to place on the CC: line of the message.
destination_ccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | The recipients to place on the BCC: line of the message.
destination_bccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.Destination.Destination


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource
newtype DimensionValueSource
DimensionValueSource' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource
[fromDimensionValueSource] :: DimensionValueSource -> Text
pattern DimensionValueSource_EmailHeader :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_LinkTag :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_MessageTag :: DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | Contains the dimension configuration to use when you publish email
--   sending events to Amazon CloudWatch.
--   
--   For information about publishing email sending events to Amazon
--   CloudWatch, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> Text

-- | The place where Amazon SES finds the value of a dimension to publish
--   to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon SES to use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt>/<tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon SES to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>.
[$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you do not provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. The default value must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName</a> - The name of an
--   Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric.
--   The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource</a> - The
--   place where Amazon SES finds the value of a dimension to publish to
--   Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon SES to use the message tags that
--   you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a parameter
--   to the <tt>SendEmail</tt>/<tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon SES to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue</a> - The
--   default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch
--   if you do not provide the value of the dimension when you send an
--   email. The default value must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text

-- | The place where Amazon SES finds the value of a dimension to publish
--   to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon SES to use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt>/<tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon SES to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>.
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you do not provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. The default value must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDestination

-- | Contains information associated with an Amazon CloudWatch event
--   destination to which email sending events are published.
--   
--   Event destinations, such as Amazon CloudWatch, are associated with
--   configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending events.
--   For information about using configuration sets, see the <a>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDestination</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchDestination
CloudWatchDestination' :: [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration] -> CloudWatchDestination

-- | A list of dimensions upon which to categorize your emails when you
--   publish email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch.
[$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'] :: CloudWatchDestination -> [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations</a> - A list of
--   dimensions upon which to categorize your emails when you publish email
--   sending events to Amazon CloudWatch.
newCloudWatchDestination :: CloudWatchDestination

-- | A list of dimensions upon which to categorize your emails when you
--   publish email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch.
cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations :: Lens' CloudWatchDestination [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField

-- | Additional X-headers to include in the Delivery Status Notification
--   (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your behalf bounces.
--   
--   For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExtensionField</a> smart constructor.
data ExtensionField
ExtensionField' :: Text -> Text -> ExtensionField

-- | The name of the header to add. Must be between 1 and 50 characters,
--   inclusive, and consist of alphanumeric (a-z, A-Z, 0-9) characters and
--   dashes only.
[$sel:name:ExtensionField'] :: ExtensionField -> Text

-- | The value of the header to add. Must be less than 2048 characters, and
--   must not contain newline characters ("\r" or "\n").
[$sel:value:ExtensionField'] :: ExtensionField -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExtensionField</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ExtensionField'</a>, <a>extensionField_name</a> - The
--   name of the header to add. Must be between 1 and 50 characters,
--   inclusive, and consist of alphanumeric (a-z, A-Z, 0-9) characters and
--   dashes only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ExtensionField'</a>, <a>extensionField_value</a> - The
--   value of the header to add. Must be less than 2048 characters, and
--   must not contain newline characters ("\r" or "\n").
newExtensionField :: Text -> Text -> ExtensionField

-- | The name of the header to add. Must be between 1 and 50 characters,
--   inclusive, and consist of alphanumeric (a-z, A-Z, 0-9) characters and
--   dashes only.
extensionField_name :: Lens' ExtensionField Text

-- | The value of the header to add. Must be less than 2048 characters, and
--   must not contain newline characters ("\r" or "\n").
extensionField_value :: Lens' ExtensionField Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.ExtensionField.ExtensionField


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes

-- | Represents the custom MAIL FROM domain attributes of a verified
--   identity (email address or domain).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityMailFromDomainAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes' :: Text -> CustomMailFromStatus -> BehaviorOnMXFailure -> IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes

-- | The custom MAIL FROM domain that the identity is configured to use.
[$sel:mailFromDomain:IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes'] :: IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes -> Text

-- | The state that indicates whether Amazon SES has successfully read the
--   MX record required for custom MAIL FROM domain setup. If the state is
--   <tt>Success</tt>, Amazon SES uses the specified custom MAIL FROM
--   domain when the verified identity sends an email. All other states
--   indicate that Amazon SES takes the action described by
--   <tt>BehaviorOnMXFailure</tt>.
[$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes'] :: IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes -> CustomMailFromStatus

-- | The action that Amazon SES takes if it cannot successfully read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. A value of
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt> indicates that if Amazon SES cannot read the
--   required MX record, it uses amazonses.com (or a subdomain of that) as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. A value of <tt>RejectMessage</tt> indicates that
--   if Amazon SES cannot read the required MX record, Amazon SES returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error and does not send the email.
--   
--   The custom MAIL FROM setup states that result in this behavior are
--   <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt>.
[$sel:behaviorOnMXFailure:IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes'] :: IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes -> BehaviorOnMXFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityMailFromDomainAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The custom
--   MAIL FROM domain that the identity is configured to use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityMailFromDomainAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus</a> - The
--   state that indicates whether Amazon SES has successfully read the MX
--   record required for custom MAIL FROM domain setup. If the state is
--   <tt>Success</tt>, Amazon SES uses the specified custom MAIL FROM
--   domain when the verified identity sends an email. All other states
--   indicate that Amazon SES takes the action described by
--   <tt>BehaviorOnMXFailure</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMXFailure:IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityMailFromDomainAttributes_behaviorOnMXFailure</a> - The
--   action that Amazon SES takes if it cannot successfully read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. A value of
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt> indicates that if Amazon SES cannot read the
--   required MX record, it uses amazonses.com (or a subdomain of that) as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. A value of <tt>RejectMessage</tt> indicates that
--   if Amazon SES cannot read the required MX record, Amazon SES returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error and does not send the email.
--   
--   The custom MAIL FROM setup states that result in this behavior are
--   <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt>.
newIdentityMailFromDomainAttributes :: Text -> CustomMailFromStatus -> BehaviorOnMXFailure -> IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes

-- | The custom MAIL FROM domain that the identity is configured to use.
identityMailFromDomainAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes Text

-- | The state that indicates whether Amazon SES has successfully read the
--   MX record required for custom MAIL FROM domain setup. If the state is
--   <tt>Success</tt>, Amazon SES uses the specified custom MAIL FROM
--   domain when the verified identity sends an email. All other states
--   indicate that Amazon SES takes the action described by
--   <tt>BehaviorOnMXFailure</tt>.
identityMailFromDomainAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus :: Lens' IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes CustomMailFromStatus

-- | The action that Amazon SES takes if it cannot successfully read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. A value of
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt> indicates that if Amazon SES cannot read the
--   required MX record, it uses amazonses.com (or a subdomain of that) as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. A value of <tt>RejectMessage</tt> indicates that
--   if Amazon SES cannot read the required MX record, Amazon SES returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error and does not send the email.
--   
--   The custom MAIL FROM setup states that result in this behavior are
--   <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt>.
identityMailFromDomainAttributes_behaviorOnMXFailure :: Lens' IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes BehaviorOnMXFailure
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes.IdentityMailFromDomainAttributes


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes

-- | Represents the notification attributes of an identity, including
--   whether an identity has Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon
--   SNS) topics set for bounce, complaint, and/or delivery notifications,
--   and whether feedback forwarding is enabled for bounce and complaint
--   notifications.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityNotificationAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data IdentityNotificationAttributes
IdentityNotificationAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Bool -> IdentityNotificationAttributes

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Complaint</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in
--   complaint notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that
--   Amazon SES will not include headers in complaint notifications.
[$sel:headersInComplaintNotificationsEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Delivery</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in
--   delivery notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that
--   Amazon SES will not include headers in delivery notifications.
[$sel:headersInDeliveryNotificationsEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Bounce</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in bounce
--   notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that Amazon SES
--   will not include headers in bounce notifications.
[$sel:headersInBounceNotificationsEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon
--   SES will publish bounce notifications.
[$sel:bounceTopic:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon
--   SES will publish complaint notifications.
[$sel:complaintTopic:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon
--   SES will publish delivery notifications.
[$sel:deliveryTopic:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Text

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES will forward bounce and complaint
--   notifications as email. <tt>true</tt> indicates that Amazon SES will
--   forward bounce and complaint notifications as email, while
--   <tt>false</tt> indicates that bounce and complaint notifications will
--   be published only to the specified bounce and complaint Amazon SNS
--   topics.
[$sel:forwardingEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'] :: IdentityNotificationAttributes -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityNotificationAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:headersInComplaintNotificationsEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_headersInComplaintNotificationsEnabled</a>
--   - Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Complaint</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in
--   complaint notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that
--   Amazon SES will not include headers in complaint notifications.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:headersInDeliveryNotificationsEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_headersInDeliveryNotificationsEnabled</a>
--   - Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Delivery</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in
--   delivery notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that
--   Amazon SES will not include headers in delivery notifications.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:headersInBounceNotificationsEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_headersInBounceNotificationsEnabled</a>
--   - Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Bounce</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in bounce
--   notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that Amazon SES
--   will not include headers in bounce notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bounceTopic:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_bounceTopic</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon SES will
--   publish bounce notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:complaintTopic:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_complaintTopic</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon SES will
--   publish complaint notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryTopic:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_deliveryTopic</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon SES will
--   publish delivery notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardingEnabled:IdentityNotificationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>identityNotificationAttributes_forwardingEnabled</a> - Describes
--   whether Amazon SES will forward bounce and complaint notifications as
--   email. <tt>true</tt> indicates that Amazon SES will forward bounce and
--   complaint notifications as email, while <tt>false</tt> indicates that
--   bounce and complaint notifications will be published only to the
--   specified bounce and complaint Amazon SNS topics.
newIdentityNotificationAttributes :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Bool -> IdentityNotificationAttributes

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Complaint</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in
--   complaint notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that
--   Amazon SES will not include headers in complaint notifications.
identityNotificationAttributes_headersInComplaintNotificationsEnabled :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Delivery</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in
--   delivery notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that
--   Amazon SES will not include headers in delivery notifications.
identityNotificationAttributes_headersInDeliveryNotificationsEnabled :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES includes the original email headers in
--   Amazon SNS notifications of type <tt>Bounce</tt>. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies that Amazon SES will include headers in bounce
--   notifications, and a value of <tt>false</tt> specifies that Amazon SES
--   will not include headers in bounce notifications.
identityNotificationAttributes_headersInBounceNotificationsEnabled :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon
--   SES will publish bounce notifications.
identityNotificationAttributes_bounceTopic :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon
--   SES will publish complaint notifications.
identityNotificationAttributes_complaintTopic :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic where Amazon
--   SES will publish delivery notifications.
identityNotificationAttributes_deliveryTopic :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes Text

-- | Describes whether Amazon SES will forward bounce and complaint
--   notifications as email. <tt>true</tt> indicates that Amazon SES will
--   forward bounce and complaint notifications as email, while
--   <tt>false</tt> indicates that bounce and complaint notifications will
--   be published only to the specified bounce and complaint Amazon SNS
--   topics.
identityNotificationAttributes_forwardingEnabled :: Lens' IdentityNotificationAttributes Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.IdentityNotificationAttributes.IdentityNotificationAttributes

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | Contains the delivery stream ARN and the IAM role ARN associated with
--   an Amazon Kinesis Firehose event destination.
--   
--   Event destinations, such as Amazon Kinesis Firehose, are associated
--   with configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending
--   events. For information about using configuration sets, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisFirehoseDestination</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisFirehoseDestination
KinesisFirehoseDestination' :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The ARN of the IAM role under which Amazon SES publishes email sending
--   events to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
[$sel:iAMRoleARN:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream that email sending
--   events should be published to.
[$sel:deliveryStreamARN:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisFirehoseDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iAMRoleARN:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_iAMRoleARN</a> - The ARN of the IAM role
--   under which Amazon SES publishes email sending events to the Amazon
--   Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamARN:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamARN</a> - The ARN of the
--   Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream that email sending events should be
--   published to.
newKinesisFirehoseDestination :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The ARN of the IAM role under which Amazon SES publishes email sending
--   events to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_iAMRoleARN :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream that email sending
--   events should be published to.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamARN :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction

-- | When included in a receipt rule, this action calls an AWS Lambda
--   function and, optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS).
--   
--   To enable Amazon SES to call your AWS Lambda function or to publish to
--   an Amazon SNS topic of another account, Amazon SES must have
--   permission to access those resources. For information about giving
--   permissions, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   For information about using AWS Lambda actions in receipt rules, see
--   the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaAction</a> smart constructor.
data LambdaAction
LambdaAction' :: Maybe InvocationType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> LambdaAction

-- | The invocation type of the AWS Lambda function. An invocation type of
--   <tt>RequestResponse</tt> means that the execution of the function will
--   immediately result in a response, and a value of <tt>Event</tt> means
--   that the function will be invoked asynchronously. The default value is
--   <tt>Event</tt>. For information about AWS Lambda invocation types, see
--   the <a>AWS Lambda Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   There is a 30-second timeout on <tt>RequestResponse</tt> invocations.
--   You should use <tt>Event</tt> invocation in most cases. Use
--   <tt>RequestResponse</tt> only when you want to make a mail flow
--   decision, such as whether to stop the receipt rule or the receipt rule
--   set.
[$sel:invocationType:LambdaAction'] :: LambdaAction -> Maybe InvocationType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when
--   the Lambda action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:LambdaAction'] :: LambdaAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function. An example
--   of an AWS Lambda function ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:account-id:function:MyFunction</tt>. For
--   more information about AWS Lambda, see the <a>AWS Lambda Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:functionArn:LambdaAction'] :: LambdaAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:invocationType:LambdaAction'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaAction_invocationType</a> - The invocation type of the AWS
--   Lambda function. An invocation type of <tt>RequestResponse</tt> means
--   that the execution of the function will immediately result in a
--   response, and a value of <tt>Event</tt> means that the function will
--   be invoked asynchronously. The default value is <tt>Event</tt>. For
--   information about AWS Lambda invocation types, see the <a>AWS Lambda
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   There is a 30-second timeout on <tt>RequestResponse</tt> invocations.
--   You should use <tt>Event</tt> invocation in most cases. Use
--   <tt>RequestResponse</tt> only when you want to make a mail flow
--   decision, such as whether to stop the receipt rule or the receipt rule
--   set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:LambdaAction'</a>, <a>lambdaAction_topicArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the
--   Lambda action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:functionArn:LambdaAction'</a>, <a>lambdaAction_functionArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function. An
--   example of an AWS Lambda function ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:account-id:function:MyFunction</tt>. For
--   more information about AWS Lambda, see the <a>AWS Lambda Developer
--   Guide</a>.
newLambdaAction :: Text -> LambdaAction

-- | The invocation type of the AWS Lambda function. An invocation type of
--   <tt>RequestResponse</tt> means that the execution of the function will
--   immediately result in a response, and a value of <tt>Event</tt> means
--   that the function will be invoked asynchronously. The default value is
--   <tt>Event</tt>. For information about AWS Lambda invocation types, see
--   the <a>AWS Lambda Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   There is a 30-second timeout on <tt>RequestResponse</tt> invocations.
--   You should use <tt>Event</tt> invocation in most cases. Use
--   <tt>RequestResponse</tt> only when you want to make a mail flow
--   decision, such as whether to stop the receipt rule or the receipt rule
--   set.
lambdaAction_invocationType :: Lens' LambdaAction (Maybe InvocationType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when
--   the Lambda action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
lambdaAction_topicArn :: Lens' LambdaAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function. An example
--   of an AWS Lambda function ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:account-id:function:MyFunction</tt>. For
--   more information about AWS Lambda, see the <a>AWS Lambda Developer
--   Guide</a>.
lambdaAction_functionArn :: Lens' LambdaAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.LambdaAction.LambdaAction


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message

-- | Represents the message to be sent, composed of a subject and a body.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject of the message: A short summary of the content, which will
--   appear in the recipient's inbox.
[$sel:subject:Message'] :: Message -> Content

-- | The message body.
[$sel:body:Message'] :: Message -> Body

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:Message'</a>, <a>message_subject</a> - The subject of
--   the message: A short summary of the content, which will appear in the
--   recipient's inbox.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The message body.
newMessage :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject of the message: A short summary of the content, which will
--   appear in the recipient's inbox.
message_subject :: Lens' Message Content

-- | The message body.
message_body :: Lens' Message Body
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.Message.Message


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn

-- | Message-related information to include in the Delivery Status
--   Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your
--   behalf bounces.
--   
--   For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageDsn</a> smart constructor.
data MessageDsn
MessageDsn' :: Maybe [ExtensionField] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> MessageDsn

-- | Additional X-headers to include in the DSN.
[$sel:extensionFields:MessageDsn'] :: MessageDsn -> Maybe [ExtensionField]

-- | When the message was received by the reporting mail transfer agent
--   (MTA), in <a>RFC 822</a> date-time format.
[$sel:arrivalDate:MessageDsn'] :: MessageDsn -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The reporting MTA that attempted to deliver the message, formatted as
--   specified in <a>RFC 3464</a> (<tt>mta-name-type; mta-name</tt>). The
--   default value is <tt>dns; inbound-smtp.[region].amazonaws.com</tt>.
[$sel:reportingMta:MessageDsn'] :: MessageDsn -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageDsn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:extensionFields:MessageDsn'</a>,
--   <a>messageDsn_extensionFields</a> - Additional X-headers to include in
--   the DSN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arrivalDate:MessageDsn'</a>, <a>messageDsn_arrivalDate</a> -
--   When the message was received by the reporting mail transfer agent
--   (MTA), in <a>RFC 822</a> date-time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportingMta:MessageDsn'</a>, <a>messageDsn_reportingMta</a> -
--   The reporting MTA that attempted to deliver the message, formatted as
--   specified in <a>RFC 3464</a> (<tt>mta-name-type; mta-name</tt>). The
--   default value is <tt>dns; inbound-smtp.[region].amazonaws.com</tt>.
newMessageDsn :: Text -> MessageDsn

-- | Additional X-headers to include in the DSN.
messageDsn_extensionFields :: Lens' MessageDsn (Maybe [ExtensionField])

-- | When the message was received by the reporting mail transfer agent
--   (MTA), in <a>RFC 822</a> date-time format.
messageDsn_arrivalDate :: Lens' MessageDsn (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reporting MTA that attempted to deliver the message, formatted as
--   specified in <a>RFC 3464</a> (<tt>mta-name-type; mta-name</tt>). The
--   default value is <tt>dns; inbound-smtp.[region].amazonaws.com</tt>.
messageDsn_reportingMta :: Lens' MessageDsn Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageDsn.MessageDsn


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag

-- | Contains the name and value of a tag that you can provide to
--   <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> to apply to an email.
--   
--   Message tags, which you use with configuration sets, enable you to
--   publish email sending events. For information about using
--   configuration sets, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageTag</a> smart constructor.
data MessageTag
MessageTag' :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the tag. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | The value of the tag. The value must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:value:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_name</a> - The name of the
--   tag. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_value</a> - The value of
--   the tag. The value must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newMessageTag :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the tag. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_name :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | The value of the tag. The value must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_value :: Lens' MessageTag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination

-- | An array that contains one or more Destinations, as well as the tags
--   and replacement data associated with each of those Destinations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailDestination</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailDestination
BulkEmailDestination' :: Maybe [MessageTag] -> Maybe Text -> Destination -> BulkEmailDestination

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>. Tags correspond
--   to characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can
--   publish email sending events.
[$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailDestination'] :: BulkEmailDestination -> Maybe [MessageTag]

-- | A list of replacement values to apply to the template. This parameter
--   is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the
--   keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.
[$sel:replacementTemplateData:BulkEmailDestination'] :: BulkEmailDestination -> Maybe Text
[$sel:destination:BulkEmailDestination'] :: BulkEmailDestination -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailDestination'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailDestination_replacementTags</a> - A list of tags, in the
--   form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>. Tags correspond to characteristics of
--   the email that you define, so that you can publish email sending
--   events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementTemplateData:BulkEmailDestination'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailDestination_replacementTemplateData</a> - A list of
--   replacement values to apply to the template. This parameter is a JSON
--   object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the keys
--   correspond to replacement tags in the email template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:BulkEmailDestination'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailDestination_destination</a> - Undocumented member.
newBulkEmailDestination :: Destination -> BulkEmailDestination

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>. Tags correspond
--   to characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can
--   publish email sending events.
bulkEmailDestination_replacementTags :: Lens' BulkEmailDestination (Maybe [MessageTag])

-- | A list of replacement values to apply to the template. This parameter
--   is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the
--   keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.
bulkEmailDestination_replacementTemplateData :: Lens' BulkEmailDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
bulkEmailDestination_destination :: Lens' BulkEmailDestination Destination
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.BulkEmailDestination.BulkEmailDestination

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage

-- | Represents the raw data of the message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawMessage</a> smart constructor.
data RawMessage
RawMessage' :: Base64 -> RawMessage

-- | The raw data of the message. This data needs to base64-encoded if you
--   are accessing Amazon SES directly through the HTTPS interface. If you
--   are accessing Amazon SES using an AWS SDK, the SDK takes care of the
--   base 64-encoding for you. In all cases, the client must ensure that
--   the message format complies with Internet email standards regarding
--   email header fields, MIME types, and MIME encoding.
--   
--   The To:, CC:, and BCC: headers in the raw message can contain a group
--   list.
--   
--   If you are using <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> with sending authorization, you
--   can include X-headers in the raw message to specify the "Source,"
--   "From," and "Return-Path" addresses. For more information, see the
--   documentation for <tt>SendRawEmail</tt>.
--   
--   Do not include these X-headers in the DKIM signature, because they are
--   removed by Amazon SES before sending the email.
--   
--   For more information, go to the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:data':RawMessage'] :: RawMessage -> Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RawMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawMessage'</a>, <a>rawMessage_data</a> - The raw data
--   of the message. This data needs to base64-encoded if you are accessing
--   Amazon SES directly through the HTTPS interface. If you are accessing
--   Amazon SES using an AWS SDK, the SDK takes care of the base
--   64-encoding for you. In all cases, the client must ensure that the
--   message format complies with Internet email standards regarding email
--   header fields, MIME types, and MIME encoding.
--   
--   The To:, CC:, and BCC: headers in the raw message can contain a group
--   list.
--   
--   If you are using <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> with sending authorization, you
--   can include X-headers in the raw message to specify the "Source,"
--   "From," and "Return-Path" addresses. For more information, see the
--   documentation for <tt>SendRawEmail</tt>.
--   
--   Do not include these X-headers in the DKIM signature, because they are
--   removed by Amazon SES before sending the email.
--   
--   For more information, go to the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.--
--   -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
newRawMessage :: ByteString -> RawMessage

-- | The raw data of the message. This data needs to base64-encoded if you
--   are accessing Amazon SES directly through the HTTPS interface. If you
--   are accessing Amazon SES using an AWS SDK, the SDK takes care of the
--   base 64-encoding for you. In all cases, the client must ensure that
--   the message format complies with Internet email standards regarding
--   email header fields, MIME types, and MIME encoding.
--   
--   The To:, CC:, and BCC: headers in the raw message can contain a group
--   list.
--   
--   If you are using <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> with sending authorization, you
--   can include X-headers in the raw message to specify the "Source,"
--   "From," and "Return-Path" addresses. For more information, see the
--   documentation for <tt>SendRawEmail</tt>.
--   
--   Do not include these X-headers in the DKIM signature, because they are
--   removed by Amazon SES before sending the email.
--   
--   For more information, go to the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.--
--   -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
rawMessage_data :: Lens' RawMessage ByteString
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage

ReceiptFilterPolicy' :: Text -> ReceiptFilterPolicy
[fromReceiptFilterPolicy] :: ReceiptFilterPolicy -> Text
pattern ReceiptFilterPolicy_Allow :: ReceiptFilterPolicy
pattern ReceiptFilterPolicy_Block :: ReceiptFilterPolicy
