module Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter

-- | A receipt IP address filter enables you to specify whether to accept
--   or reject mail originating from an IP address or range of IP
--   addresses.
--   
--   For information about setting up IP address filters, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReceiptIpFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ReceiptIpFilter
ReceiptIpFilter' :: ReceiptFilterPolicy -> Text -> ReceiptIpFilter

-- | Indicates whether to block or allow incoming mail from the specified
--   IP addresses.
[$sel:policy:ReceiptIpFilter'] :: ReceiptIpFilter -> ReceiptFilterPolicy

-- | A single IP address or a range of IP addresses that you want to block
--   or allow, specified in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation.
--   An example of a single email address is 10.0.0.1. An example of a
--   range of IP addresses is 10.0.0.1/24. For more information about CIDR
--   notation, see <a>RFC 2317</a>.
[$sel:cidr:ReceiptIpFilter'] :: ReceiptIpFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReceiptIpFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:ReceiptIpFilter'</a>, <a>receiptIpFilter_policy</a> -
--   Indicates whether to block or allow incoming mail from the specified
--   IP addresses.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cidr:ReceiptIpFilter'</a>, <a>receiptIpFilter_cidr</a> - A
--   single IP address or a range of IP addresses that you want to block or
--   allow, specified in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. An
--   example of a single email address is 10.0.0.1. An example of a range
--   of IP addresses is 10.0.0.1/24. For more information about CIDR
--   notation, see <a>RFC 2317</a>.
newReceiptIpFilter :: ReceiptFilterPolicy -> Text -> ReceiptIpFilter

-- | Indicates whether to block or allow incoming mail from the specified
--   IP addresses.
receiptIpFilter_policy :: Lens' ReceiptIpFilter ReceiptFilterPolicy

-- | A single IP address or a range of IP addresses that you want to block
--   or allow, specified in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation.
--   An example of a single email address is 10.0.0.1. An example of a
--   range of IP addresses is 10.0.0.1/24. For more information about CIDR
--   notation, see <a>RFC 2317</a>.
receiptIpFilter_cidr :: Lens' ReceiptIpFilter Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptIpFilter.ReceiptIpFilter


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter

-- | A receipt IP address filter enables you to specify whether to accept
--   or reject mail originating from an IP address or range of IP
--   addresses.
--   
--   For information about setting up IP address filters, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReceiptFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ReceiptFilter
ReceiptFilter' :: Text -> ReceiptIpFilter -> ReceiptFilter

-- | The name of the IP address filter. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Start and end with a letter or number.</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:ReceiptFilter'] :: ReceiptFilter -> Text

-- | A structure that provides the IP addresses to block or allow, and
--   whether to block or allow incoming mail from them.
[$sel:ipFilter:ReceiptFilter'] :: ReceiptFilter -> ReceiptIpFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ReceiptFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ReceiptFilter'</a>, <a>receiptFilter_name</a> - The name
--   of the IP address filter. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Start and end with a letter or number.</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipFilter:ReceiptFilter'</a>, <a>receiptFilter_ipFilter</a> - A
--   structure that provides the IP addresses to block or allow, and
--   whether to block or allow incoming mail from them.
newReceiptFilter :: Text -> ReceiptIpFilter -> ReceiptFilter

-- | The name of the IP address filter. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Start and end with a letter or number.</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
receiptFilter_name :: Lens' ReceiptFilter Text

-- | A structure that provides the IP addresses to block or allow, and
--   whether to block or allow incoming mail from them.
receiptFilter_ipFilter :: Lens' ReceiptFilter ReceiptIpFilter
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptFilter.ReceiptFilter


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata

-- | Information about a receipt rule set.
--   
--   A receipt rule set is a collection of rules that specify what Amazon
--   SES should do with mail it receives on behalf of your account's
--   verified domains.
--   
--   For information about setting up receipt rule sets, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReceiptRuleSetMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
ReceiptRuleSetMetadata' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> ReceiptRuleSetMetadata

-- | The date and time the receipt rule set was created.
[$sel:createdTimestamp:ReceiptRuleSetMetadata'] :: ReceiptRuleSetMetadata -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the receipt rule set. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Start and end with a letter or number.</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:ReceiptRuleSetMetadata'] :: ReceiptRuleSetMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReceiptRuleSetMetadata</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTimestamp:ReceiptRuleSetMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>receiptRuleSetMetadata_createdTimestamp</a> - The date and time the
--   receipt rule set was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ReceiptRuleSetMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>receiptRuleSetMetadata_name</a> - The name of the receipt rule set.
--   The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Start and end with a letter or number.</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newReceiptRuleSetMetadata :: ReceiptRuleSetMetadata

-- | The date and time the receipt rule set was created.
receiptRuleSetMetadata_createdTimestamp :: Lens' ReceiptRuleSetMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the receipt rule set. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Start and end with a letter or number.</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
receiptRuleSetMetadata_name :: Lens' ReceiptRuleSetMetadata (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata.ReceiptRuleSetMetadata


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields

-- | Recipient-related information to include in the Delivery Status
--   Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your
--   behalf bounces.
--   
--   For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecipientDsnFields</a> smart constructor.
data RecipientDsnFields
RecipientDsnFields' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [ExtensionField] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DsnAction -> Text -> RecipientDsnFields

-- | The MTA to which the remote MTA attempted to deliver the message,
--   formatted as specified in <a>RFC 3464</a> (<tt>mta-name-type;
--   mta-name</tt>). This parameter typically applies only to propagating
--   synchronous bounces.
[$sel:remoteMta:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the final delivery attempt was made, in <a>RFC 822</a>
--   date-time format.
[$sel:lastAttemptDate:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Additional X-headers to include in the DSN.
[$sel:extensionFields:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> Maybe [ExtensionField]

-- | An extended explanation of what went wrong; this is usually an SMTP
--   response. See <a>RFC 3463</a> for the correct formatting of this
--   parameter.
[$sel:diagnosticCode:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address that the message was ultimately delivered to. This
--   corresponds to the <tt>Final-Recipient</tt> in the DSN. If not
--   specified, <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> will be set to the
--   <tt>Recipient</tt> specified in the <tt>BouncedRecipientInfo</tt>
--   structure. Either <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> or the recipient in
--   <tt>BouncedRecipientInfo</tt> must be a recipient of the original
--   bounced message.
--   
--   Do not prepend the <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> email address with <tt>rfc
--   822;</tt>, as described in <a>RFC 3798</a>.
[$sel:finalRecipient:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> Maybe Text

-- | The action performed by the reporting mail transfer agent (MTA) as a
--   result of its attempt to deliver the message to the recipient address.
--   This is required by <a>RFC 3464</a>.
[$sel:action:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> DsnAction

-- | The status code that indicates what went wrong. This is required by
--   <a>RFC 3464</a>.
[$sel:status:RecipientDsnFields'] :: RecipientDsnFields -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecipientDsnFields</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:remoteMta:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_remoteMta</a> - The MTA to which the remote MTA
--   attempted to deliver the message, formatted as specified in <a>RFC
--   3464</a> (<tt>mta-name-type; mta-name</tt>). This parameter typically
--   applies only to propagating synchronous bounces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAttemptDate:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_lastAttemptDate</a> - The time the final
--   delivery attempt was made, in <a>RFC 822</a> date-time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extensionFields:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_extensionFields</a> - Additional X-headers to
--   include in the DSN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diagnosticCode:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_diagnosticCode</a> - An extended explanation of
--   what went wrong; this is usually an SMTP response. See <a>RFC 3463</a>
--   for the correct formatting of this parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:finalRecipient:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_finalRecipient</a> - The email address that the
--   message was ultimately delivered to. This corresponds to the
--   <tt>Final-Recipient</tt> in the DSN. If not specified,
--   <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> will be set to the <tt>Recipient</tt>
--   specified in the <tt>BouncedRecipientInfo</tt> structure. Either
--   <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> or the recipient in
--   <tt>BouncedRecipientInfo</tt> must be a recipient of the original
--   bounced message.
--   
--   Do not prepend the <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> email address with <tt>rfc
--   822;</tt>, as described in <a>RFC 3798</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_action</a> - The action performed by the
--   reporting mail transfer agent (MTA) as a result of its attempt to
--   deliver the message to the recipient address. This is required by
--   <a>RFC 3464</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RecipientDsnFields'</a>,
--   <a>recipientDsnFields_status</a> - The status code that indicates what
--   went wrong. This is required by <a>RFC 3464</a>.
newRecipientDsnFields :: DsnAction -> Text -> RecipientDsnFields

-- | The MTA to which the remote MTA attempted to deliver the message,
--   formatted as specified in <a>RFC 3464</a> (<tt>mta-name-type;
--   mta-name</tt>). This parameter typically applies only to propagating
--   synchronous bounces.
recipientDsnFields_remoteMta :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the final delivery attempt was made, in <a>RFC 822</a>
--   date-time format.
recipientDsnFields_lastAttemptDate :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Additional X-headers to include in the DSN.
recipientDsnFields_extensionFields :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields (Maybe [ExtensionField])

-- | An extended explanation of what went wrong; this is usually an SMTP
--   response. See <a>RFC 3463</a> for the correct formatting of this
--   parameter.
recipientDsnFields_diagnosticCode :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address that the message was ultimately delivered to. This
--   corresponds to the <tt>Final-Recipient</tt> in the DSN. If not
--   specified, <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> will be set to the
--   <tt>Recipient</tt> specified in the <tt>BouncedRecipientInfo</tt>
--   structure. Either <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> or the recipient in
--   <tt>BouncedRecipientInfo</tt> must be a recipient of the original
--   bounced message.
--   
--   Do not prepend the <tt>FinalRecipient</tt> email address with <tt>rfc
--   822;</tt>, as described in <a>RFC 3798</a>.
recipientDsnFields_finalRecipient :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields (Maybe Text)

-- | The action performed by the reporting mail transfer agent (MTA) as a
--   result of its attempt to deliver the message to the recipient address.
--   This is required by <a>RFC 3464</a>.
recipientDsnFields_action :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields DsnAction

-- | The status code that indicates what went wrong. This is required by
--   <a>RFC 3464</a>.
recipientDsnFields_status :: Lens' RecipientDsnFields Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.RecipientDsnFields.RecipientDsnFields


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo

-- | Recipient-related information to include in the Delivery Status
--   Notification (DSN) when an email that Amazon SES receives on your
--   behalf bounces.
--   
--   For information about receiving email through Amazon SES, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBouncedRecipientInfo</a> smart constructor.
data BouncedRecipientInfo
BouncedRecipientInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RecipientDsnFields -> Maybe BounceType -> Text -> BouncedRecipientInfo

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to receive email for the recipient of the
--   bounced email. For more information about sending authorization, see
--   the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:recipientArn:BouncedRecipientInfo'] :: BouncedRecipientInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Recipient-related DSN fields, most of which would normally be filled
--   in automatically when provided with a <tt>BounceType</tt>. You must
--   provide either this parameter or <tt>BounceType</tt>.
[$sel:recipientDsnFields:BouncedRecipientInfo'] :: BouncedRecipientInfo -> Maybe RecipientDsnFields

-- | The reason for the bounce. You must provide either this parameter or
--   <tt>RecipientDsnFields</tt>.
[$sel:bounceType:BouncedRecipientInfo'] :: BouncedRecipientInfo -> Maybe BounceType

-- | The email address of the recipient of the bounced email.
[$sel:recipient:BouncedRecipientInfo'] :: BouncedRecipientInfo -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BouncedRecipientInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recipientArn:BouncedRecipientInfo'</a>,
--   <a>bouncedRecipientInfo_recipientArn</a> - This parameter is used only
--   for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the identity that is
--   associated with the sending authorization policy that permits you to
--   receive email for the recipient of the bounced email. For more
--   information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recipientDsnFields:BouncedRecipientInfo'</a>,
--   <a>bouncedRecipientInfo_recipientDsnFields</a> - Recipient-related DSN
--   fields, most of which would normally be filled in automatically when
--   provided with a <tt>BounceType</tt>. You must provide either this
--   parameter or <tt>BounceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bounceType:BouncedRecipientInfo'</a>,
--   <a>bouncedRecipientInfo_bounceType</a> - The reason for the bounce.
--   You must provide either this parameter or <tt>RecipientDsnFields</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recipient:BouncedRecipientInfo'</a>,
--   <a>bouncedRecipientInfo_recipient</a> - The email address of the
--   recipient of the bounced email.
newBouncedRecipientInfo :: Text -> BouncedRecipientInfo

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to receive email for the recipient of the
--   bounced email. For more information about sending authorization, see
--   the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
bouncedRecipientInfo_recipientArn :: Lens' BouncedRecipientInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Recipient-related DSN fields, most of which would normally be filled
--   in automatically when provided with a <tt>BounceType</tt>. You must
--   provide either this parameter or <tt>BounceType</tt>.
bouncedRecipientInfo_recipientDsnFields :: Lens' BouncedRecipientInfo (Maybe RecipientDsnFields)

-- | The reason for the bounce. You must provide either this parameter or
--   <tt>RecipientDsnFields</tt>.
bouncedRecipientInfo_bounceType :: Lens' BouncedRecipientInfo (Maybe BounceType)

-- | The email address of the recipient of the bounced email.
bouncedRecipientInfo_recipient :: Lens' BouncedRecipientInfo Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.BouncedRecipientInfo.BouncedRecipientInfo


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions

-- | Contains information about the reputation settings for a configuration
--   set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReputationOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ReputationOptions
ReputationOptions' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> ReputationOptions

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon SES publishes reputation metrics for
--   the configuration set, such as bounce and complaint rates, to Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, reputation metrics are published. If
--   the value is <tt>false</tt>, reputation metrics are not published. The
--   default value is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time at which the reputation metrics for the
--   configuration set were last reset. Resetting these metrics is known as
--   a /fresh start/.
--   
--   When you disable email sending for a configuration set using
--   UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled and later re-enable it, the
--   reputation metrics for the configuration set (but not for the entire
--   Amazon SES account) are reset.
--   
--   If email sending for the configuration set has never been disabled and
--   later re-enabled, the value of this attribute is <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Describes whether email sending is enabled or disabled for the
--   configuration set. If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then Amazon SES will
--   send emails that use the configuration set. If the value is
--   <tt>false</tt>, Amazon SES will not send emails that use the
--   configuration set. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. You can change
--   this setting using UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ReputationOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled</a> - Describes whether
--   or not Amazon SES publishes reputation metrics for the configuration
--   set, such as bounce and complaint rates, to Amazon CloudWatch.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, reputation metrics are published. If
--   the value is <tt>false</tt>, reputation metrics are not published. The
--   default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_lastFreshStart</a> - The date and time at which
--   the reputation metrics for the configuration set were last reset.
--   Resetting these metrics is known as a /fresh start/.
--   
--   When you disable email sending for a configuration set using
--   UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled and later re-enable it, the
--   reputation metrics for the configuration set (but not for the entire
--   Amazon SES account) are reset.
--   
--   If email sending for the configuration set has never been disabled and
--   later re-enabled, the value of this attribute is <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_sendingEnabled</a> - Describes whether email
--   sending is enabled or disabled for the configuration set. If the value
--   is <tt>true</tt>, then Amazon SES will send emails that use the
--   configuration set. If the value is <tt>false</tt>, Amazon SES will not
--   send emails that use the configuration set. The default value is
--   <tt>true</tt>. You can change this setting using
--   UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled.
newReputationOptions :: ReputationOptions

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon SES publishes reputation metrics for
--   the configuration set, such as bounce and complaint rates, to Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, reputation metrics are published. If
--   the value is <tt>false</tt>, reputation metrics are not published. The
--   default value is <tt>false</tt>.
reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time at which the reputation metrics for the
--   configuration set were last reset. Resetting these metrics is known as
--   a /fresh start/.
--   
--   When you disable email sending for a configuration set using
--   UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled and later re-enable it, the
--   reputation metrics for the configuration set (but not for the entire
--   Amazon SES account) are reset.
--   
--   If email sending for the configuration set has never been disabled and
--   later re-enabled, the value of this attribute is <tt>null</tt>.
reputationOptions_lastFreshStart :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes whether email sending is enabled or disabled for the
--   configuration set. If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then Amazon SES will
--   send emails that use the configuration set. If the value is
--   <tt>false</tt>, Amazon SES will not send emails that use the
--   configuration set. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. You can change
--   this setting using UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled.
reputationOptions_sendingEnabled :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action

-- | When included in a receipt rule, this action saves the received
--   message to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket and,
--   optionally, publishes a notification to Amazon Simple Notification
--   Service (Amazon SNS).
--   
--   To enable Amazon SES to write emails to your Amazon S3 bucket, use an
--   AWS KMS key to encrypt your emails, or publish to an Amazon SNS topic
--   of another account, Amazon SES must have permission to access those
--   resources. For information about giving permissions, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   When you save your emails to an Amazon S3 bucket, the maximum email
--   size (including headers) is 30 MB. Emails larger than that will
--   bounce.
--   
--   For information about specifying Amazon S3 actions in receipt rules,
--   see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Action</a> smart constructor.
data S3Action
S3Action' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> S3Action

-- | The key prefix of the Amazon S3 bucket. The key prefix is similar to a
--   directory name that enables you to store similar data under the same
--   directory in a bucket.
[$sel:objectKeyPrefix:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Maybe Text

-- | The customer master key that Amazon SES should use to encrypt your
--   emails before saving them to the Amazon S3 bucket. You can use the
--   default master key or a custom master key you created in AWS KMS as
--   follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To use the default master key, provide an ARN in the form of
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:REGION:ACCOUNT-ID-WITHOUT-HYPHENS:alias/aws/ses</tt>.
--   For example, if your AWS account ID is 123456789012 and you want to
--   use the default master key in the US West (Oregon) region, the ARN of
--   the default master key would be
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:123456789012:alias/aws/ses</tt>. If you use
--   the default master key, you don't need to perform any extra steps to
--   give Amazon SES permission to use the key.</li>
--   <li>To use a custom master key you created in AWS KMS, provide the ARN
--   of the master key and ensure that you add a statement to your key's
--   policy to give Amazon SES permission to use it. For more information
--   about giving permissions, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about key policies, see the <a>AWS KMS Developer
--   Guide</a>. If you do not specify a master key, Amazon SES will not
--   encrypt your emails.
--   
--   Your mail is encrypted by Amazon SES using the Amazon S3 encryption
--   client before the mail is submitted to Amazon S3 for storage. It is
--   not encrypted using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. This means that
--   you must use the Amazon S3 encryption client to decrypt the email
--   after retrieving it from Amazon S3, as the service has no access to
--   use your AWS KMS keys for decryption. This encryption client is
--   currently available with the <a>AWS SDK for Java</a> and <a>AWS SDK
--   for Ruby</a> only. For more information about client-side encryption
--   using AWS KMS master keys, see the <a>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the message is saved to
--   the Amazon S3 bucket. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that incoming email will be saved to.
[$sel:bucketName:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Action</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectKeyPrefix:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_objectKeyPrefix</a>
--   - The key prefix of the Amazon S3 bucket. The key prefix is similar to
--   a directory name that enables you to store similar data under the same
--   directory in a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyArn:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_kmsKeyArn</a> - The
--   customer master key that Amazon SES should use to encrypt your emails
--   before saving them to the Amazon S3 bucket. You can use the default
--   master key or a custom master key you created in AWS KMS as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To use the default master key, provide an ARN in the form of
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:REGION:ACCOUNT-ID-WITHOUT-HYPHENS:alias/aws/ses</tt>.
--   For example, if your AWS account ID is 123456789012 and you want to
--   use the default master key in the US West (Oregon) region, the ARN of
--   the default master key would be
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:123456789012:alias/aws/ses</tt>. If you use
--   the default master key, you don't need to perform any extra steps to
--   give Amazon SES permission to use the key.</li>
--   <li>To use a custom master key you created in AWS KMS, provide the ARN
--   of the master key and ensure that you add a statement to your key's
--   policy to give Amazon SES permission to use it. For more information
--   about giving permissions, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about key policies, see the <a>AWS KMS Developer
--   Guide</a>. If you do not specify a master key, Amazon SES will not
--   encrypt your emails.
--   
--   Your mail is encrypted by Amazon SES using the Amazon S3 encryption
--   client before the mail is submitted to Amazon S3 for storage. It is
--   not encrypted using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. This means that
--   you must use the Amazon S3 encryption client to decrypt the email
--   after retrieving it from Amazon S3, as the service has no access to
--   use your AWS KMS keys for decryption. This encryption client is
--   currently available with the <a>AWS SDK for Java</a> and <a>AWS SDK
--   for Ruby</a> only. For more information about client-side encryption
--   using AWS KMS master keys, see the <a>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_topicArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the message is saved to the Amazon
--   S3 bucket. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_bucketName</a> - The
--   name of the Amazon S3 bucket that incoming email will be saved to.
newS3Action :: Text -> S3Action

-- | The key prefix of the Amazon S3 bucket. The key prefix is similar to a
--   directory name that enables you to store similar data under the same
--   directory in a bucket.
s3Action_objectKeyPrefix :: Lens' S3Action (Maybe Text)

-- | The customer master key that Amazon SES should use to encrypt your
--   emails before saving them to the Amazon S3 bucket. You can use the
--   default master key or a custom master key you created in AWS KMS as
--   follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To use the default master key, provide an ARN in the form of
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:REGION:ACCOUNT-ID-WITHOUT-HYPHENS:alias/aws/ses</tt>.
--   For example, if your AWS account ID is 123456789012 and you want to
--   use the default master key in the US West (Oregon) region, the ARN of
--   the default master key would be
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:123456789012:alias/aws/ses</tt>. If you use
--   the default master key, you don't need to perform any extra steps to
--   give Amazon SES permission to use the key.</li>
--   <li>To use a custom master key you created in AWS KMS, provide the ARN
--   of the master key and ensure that you add a statement to your key's
--   policy to give Amazon SES permission to use it. For more information
--   about giving permissions, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about key policies, see the <a>AWS KMS Developer
--   Guide</a>. If you do not specify a master key, Amazon SES will not
--   encrypt your emails.
--   
--   Your mail is encrypted by Amazon SES using the Amazon S3 encryption
--   client before the mail is submitted to Amazon S3 for storage. It is
--   not encrypted using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. This means that
--   you must use the Amazon S3 encryption client to decrypt the email
--   after retrieving it from Amazon S3, as the service has no access to
--   use your AWS KMS keys for decryption. This encryption client is
--   currently available with the <a>AWS SDK for Java</a> and <a>AWS SDK
--   for Ruby</a> only. For more information about client-side encryption
--   using AWS KMS master keys, see the <a>Amazon S3 Developer Guide</a>.
s3Action_kmsKeyArn :: Lens' S3Action (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the message is saved to
--   the Amazon S3 bucket. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
s3Action_topicArn :: Lens' S3Action (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that incoming email will be saved to.
s3Action_bucketName :: Lens' S3Action Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.S3Action.S3Action

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction

-- | When included in a receipt rule, this action publishes a notification
--   to Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS). This action
--   includes a complete copy of the email content in the Amazon SNS
--   notifications. Amazon SNS notifications for all other actions simply
--   provide information about the email. They do not include the email
--   content itself.
--   
--   If you own the Amazon SNS topic, you don't need to do anything to give
--   Amazon SES permission to publish emails to it. However, if you don't
--   own the Amazon SNS topic, you need to attach a policy to the topic to
--   give Amazon SES permissions to access it. For information about giving
--   permissions, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   You can only publish emails that are 150 KB or less (including the
--   header) to Amazon SNS. Larger emails will bounce. If you anticipate
--   emails larger than 150 KB, use the S3 action instead.
--   
--   For information about using a receipt rule to publish an Amazon SNS
--   notification, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSNSAction</a> smart constructor.
data SNSAction
SNSAction' :: Maybe SNSActionEncoding -> Text -> SNSAction

-- | The encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification.
--   UTF-8 is easier to use, but may not preserve all special characters
--   when a message was encoded with a different encoding format. Base64
--   preserves all special characters. The default value is UTF-8.
[$sel:encoding:SNSAction'] :: SNSAction -> Maybe SNSActionEncoding

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify. An
--   example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:SNSAction'] :: SNSAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SNSAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encoding:SNSAction'</a>, <a>sNSAction_encoding</a> - The
--   encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification.
--   UTF-8 is easier to use, but may not preserve all special characters
--   when a message was encoded with a different encoding format. Base64
--   preserves all special characters. The default value is UTF-8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:SNSAction'</a>, <a>sNSAction_topicArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify. An
--   example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
newSNSAction :: Text -> SNSAction

-- | The encoding to use for the email within the Amazon SNS notification.
--   UTF-8 is easier to use, but may not preserve all special characters
--   when a message was encoded with a different encoding format. Base64
--   preserves all special characters. The default value is UTF-8.
sNSAction_encoding :: Lens' SNSAction (Maybe SNSActionEncoding)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify. An
--   example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
sNSAction_topicArn :: Lens' SNSAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSAction.SNSAction


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination

-- | Contains the topic ARN associated with an Amazon Simple Notification
--   Service (Amazon SNS) event destination.
--   
--   Event destinations, such as Amazon SNS, are associated with
--   configuration sets, which enable you to publish email sending events.
--   For information about using configuration sets, see the <a>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSNSDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SNSDestination
SNSDestination' :: Text -> SNSDestination

-- | The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic that email sending events will be
--   published to. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicARN:SNSDestination'] :: SNSDestination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SNSDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicARN:SNSDestination'</a>, <a>sNSDestination_topicARN</a> -
--   The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic that email sending events will be
--   published to. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
newSNSDestination :: Text -> SNSDestination

-- | The ARN of the Amazon SNS topic that email sending events will be
--   published to. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
sNSDestination_topicARN :: Lens' SNSDestination Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.SNSDestination.SNSDestination


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination

-- | Contains information about the event destination that the specified
--   email sending events will be published to.
--   
--   When you create or update an event destination, you must provide one,
--   and only one, destination. The destination can be Amazon CloudWatch,
--   Amazon Kinesis Firehose or Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon
--   SNS).
--   
--   Event destinations are associated with configuration sets, which
--   enable you to publish email sending events to Amazon CloudWatch,
--   Amazon Kinesis Firehose, or Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon
--   SNS). For information about using configuration sets, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe SNSDestination -> Text -> [EventType] -> EventDestination

-- | An object that contains the names, default values, and sources of the
--   dimensions associated with an Amazon CloudWatch event destination.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | Sets whether Amazon SES publishes events to this destination when you
--   send an email with the associated configuration set. Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable publishing to this destination; set to
--   <tt>false</tt> to prevent publishing to this destination. The default
--   value is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that contains the delivery stream ARN and the IAM role ARN
--   associated with an Amazon Kinesis Firehose event destination.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that contains the topic ARN associated with an Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS) event destination.
[$sel:sNSDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe SNSDestination

-- | The name of the event destination. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Text

-- | The type of email sending events to publish to the event destination.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> [EventType]

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object that
--   contains the names, default values, and sources of the dimensions
--   associated with an Amazon CloudWatch event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - Sets whether Amazon SES publishes events to this destination when
--   you send an email with the associated configuration set. Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable publishing to this destination; set to
--   <tt>false</tt> to prevent publishing to this destination. The default
--   value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An object that
--   contains the delivery stream ARN and the IAM role ARN associated with
--   an Amazon Kinesis Firehose event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_sNSDestination</a> - An object that contains the
--   topic ARN associated with an Amazon Simple Notification Service
--   (Amazon SNS) event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - The
--   name of the event destination. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - The type of email sending
--   events to publish to the event destination.
newEventDestination :: Text -> EventDestination

-- | An object that contains the names, default values, and sources of the
--   dimensions associated with an Amazon CloudWatch event destination.
eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | Sets whether Amazon SES publishes events to this destination when you
--   send an email with the associated configuration set. Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable publishing to this destination; set to
--   <tt>false</tt> to prevent publishing to this destination. The default
--   value is <tt>false</tt>.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that contains the delivery stream ARN and the IAM role ARN
--   associated with an Amazon Kinesis Firehose event destination.
eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that contains the topic ARN associated with an Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS) event destination.
eventDestination_sNSDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe SNSDestination)

-- | The name of the event destination. The name must:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This value can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers
--   (0-9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>Contain less than 64 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
eventDestination_name :: Lens' EventDestination Text

-- | The type of email sending events to publish to the event destination.
eventDestination_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestination [EventType]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint

-- | Represents sending statistics data. Each <tt>SendDataPoint</tt>
--   contains statistics for a 15-minute period of sending activity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendDataPoint</a> smart constructor.
data SendDataPoint
SendDataPoint' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Integer -> SendDataPoint

-- | Number of emails that have bounced.
[$sel:bounces:SendDataPoint'] :: SendDataPoint -> Maybe Integer

-- | Number of unwanted emails that were rejected by recipients.
[$sel:complaints:SendDataPoint'] :: SendDataPoint -> Maybe Integer

-- | Number of emails rejected by Amazon SES.
[$sel:rejects:SendDataPoint'] :: SendDataPoint -> Maybe Integer

-- | Time of the data point.
[$sel:timestamp:SendDataPoint'] :: SendDataPoint -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Number of emails that have been sent.
[$sel:deliveryAttempts:SendDataPoint'] :: SendDataPoint -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>SendDataPoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bounces:SendDataPoint'</a>, <a>sendDataPoint_bounces</a> -
--   Number of emails that have bounced.
--   
--   <a>$sel:complaints:SendDataPoint'</a>, <a>sendDataPoint_complaints</a>
--   - Number of unwanted emails that were rejected by recipients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rejects:SendDataPoint'</a>, <a>sendDataPoint_rejects</a> -
--   Number of emails rejected by Amazon SES.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:SendDataPoint'</a>, <a>sendDataPoint_timestamp</a> -
--   Time of the data point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAttempts:SendDataPoint'</a>,
--   <a>sendDataPoint_deliveryAttempts</a> - Number of emails that have
--   been sent.
newSendDataPoint :: SendDataPoint

-- | Number of emails that have bounced.
sendDataPoint_bounces :: Lens' SendDataPoint (Maybe Integer)

-- | Number of unwanted emails that were rejected by recipients.
sendDataPoint_complaints :: Lens' SendDataPoint (Maybe Integer)

-- | Number of emails rejected by Amazon SES.
sendDataPoint_rejects :: Lens' SendDataPoint (Maybe Integer)

-- | Time of the data point.
sendDataPoint_timestamp :: Lens' SendDataPoint (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Number of emails that have been sent.
sendDataPoint_deliveryAttempts :: Lens' SendDataPoint (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.SendDataPoint.SendDataPoint

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction

-- | When included in a receipt rule, this action terminates the evaluation
--   of the receipt rule set and, optionally, publishes a notification to
--   Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).
--   
--   For information about setting a stop action in a receipt rule, see the
--   <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopAction</a> smart constructor.
data StopAction
StopAction' :: Maybe Text -> StopScope -> StopAction

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when
--   the stop action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:StopAction'] :: StopAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The scope of the StopAction. The only acceptable value is
--   <tt>RuleSet</tt>.
[$sel:scope:StopAction'] :: StopAction -> StopScope

-- | Create a value of <a>StopAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:StopAction'</a>, <a>stopAction_topicArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when the
--   stop action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scope:StopAction'</a>, <a>stopAction_scope</a> - The scope of
--   the StopAction. The only acceptable value is <tt>RuleSet</tt>.
newStopAction :: StopScope -> StopAction

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to notify when
--   the stop action is taken. An example of an Amazon SNS topic ARN is
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic</tt>. For more
--   information about Amazon SNS topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</a>.
stopAction_topicArn :: Lens' StopAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The scope of the StopAction. The only acceptable value is
--   <tt>RuleSet</tt>.
stopAction_scope :: Lens' StopAction StopScope
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.StopAction.StopAction


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template

-- | The content of the email, composed of a subject line, an HTML part,
--   and a text-only part.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Template

-- | The email body that will be visible to recipients whose email clients
--   do not display HTML.
[$sel:textPart:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The subject line of the email.
[$sel:subjectPart:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The HTML body of the email.
[$sel:htmlPart:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
[$sel:templateName:Template'] :: Template -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:Template'</a>, <a>template_textPart</a> - The email
--   body that will be visible to recipients whose email clients do not
--   display HTML.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subjectPart:Template'</a>, <a>template_subjectPart</a> - The
--   subject line of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:Template'</a>, <a>template_htmlPart</a> - The HTML
--   body of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateName</a> - The
--   name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send email
--   using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
newTemplate :: Text -> Template

-- | The email body that will be visible to recipients whose email clients
--   do not display HTML.
template_textPart :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The subject line of the email.
template_subjectPart :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTML body of the email.
template_htmlPart :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
template_templateName :: Lens' Template Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.Template.Template


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.TemplateMetadata

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateMetadata</a> smart constructor.

-- | The time and date the template was created.
[$sel:createdTimestamp:TemplateMetadata'] :: TemplateMetadata -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the template.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:TemplateMetadata'</a>, <a>templateMetadata_name</a> - The
--   name of the template.
newTemplateMetadata :: TemplateMetadata

-- | The name of the template.
templateMetadata_name :: Lens' TemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryOptions
DeliveryOptions' :: Maybe TlsPolicy -> DeliveryOptions

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
[$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'] :: DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TlsPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies whether messages that use
--   the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered
--   if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is
--   <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS
--   connection can't be established.
newDeliveryOptions :: DeliveryOptions

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe TlsPolicy)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions


module Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions

-- | A domain that is used to redirect email recipients to an Amazon
--   SES-operated domain. This domain captures open and click events
--   generated by Amazon SES emails.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configuring Custom Domains to Handle Open
--   and Click Tracking</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data TrackingOptions
TrackingOptions' :: Maybe Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | The custom subdomain that will be used to redirect email recipients to
--   the Amazon SES event tracking domain.
[$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'] :: TrackingOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TrackingOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain</a> - The custom subdomain
--   that will be used to redirect email recipients to the Amazon SES event
--   tracking domain.
newTrackingOptions :: TrackingOptions

-- | The custom subdomain that will be used to redirect email recipients to
--   the Amazon SES event tracking domain.
trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain :: Lens' TrackingOptions (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SES.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SES.Types.VerificationStatus.VerificationStatus
